result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and Affidavit for attorney fees - Laura Sutton $308.70
and Affidavit for attorney fees - Laura Sutton $574.00

Defendant Charles R Johnson in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM281, 15CM379, 15CM380  and 15CM416 called.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CM281 - Joint motion to delete the domestic abuse enhancer - Granted.  Guilty plea entered.

15CM379 - DRI

15CM380 - DRI - Attorney Sutton requests cash bond be applied to court costs

15CM416
Count 1 - Guilty plea
Count 2 - DRI

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  VIS filed.  State relates.  Attorney Sutton provides proof of completion of inpatient treatment and relates.  Court relates and orders:

15CM281 & 15CM416
SW - 2 years Probation - May be discharged after 1 year if DOC recommends early discharge - Must sign up for Probation by end of this week
Must maintain absolute sobriety
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must finish counseling with Bruce Everson
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Court costs - Cash bond in 15CM380 to be applied
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

(clerked by RW)
Defendant Charles R Johnson in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM416,15CM380,15CM379 and 15CM281. 
15CM416 - Bond to be amended to remove the condition of: Must be in treatment at L.E. Phillips or any other treatment facility. If Defendant leaves treatment, this bond reverts to a $1,000.00 cash bond and Defendant must report to jail.
15CM379 & 15CM380 - Bond to be amended to remove the condition of must submit to daily pbt's in both bonds.

BOND COVERS 15CM379 AND 15CM380.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must submit to daily PBTs at the Cameron Police Department at a time to be arranged with the Police Department.  PBTs to start once bond is posted and he is to contact Cameron Police Department upon his release.

Defendant Charles R Johnson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond for today.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM380 and 15CM379 called.  Laura Sutton represents through court appointment on Case No. 15CM281.  Court appoints Laura Sutton to represent in these cases as well.  Court enters not guilty pleas on his behalf and reserves jurisdictional motions.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
